alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect east central Piscataquis...southeastern Aroostook and north central Penobscot Counties... At 106 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Van Buren to near Ripogenus...and moving southeast AT 30 MPH. Locations impacted include... Presque Isle, Caribou, Millinocket, Fort Fairfield, Limestone, Van Buren, Patten, Mount Katahdin, Mapleton, Washburn, Mars Hill, Ashland, Easton, Woodland, Sherman, Island Falls, Bridgewater, Smyrna, Masardis and Mount Chase. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 277 and 283. US Highway 1 between Blaine and Van Buren. State Highway 11 between Grindstone and Stacyville, and between Sherman Station and Ashland. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow showers. * Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are occurring in this area of heavy snow showers. Travel is not advised during these heavy snow showers. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the snow showers pass your location. If traveling pull off to a safe location. To report impactful winter weather, contact the National Weather Service office in Caribou, by calling 1-800-909- 5970 or visit https://inws.ncep.noaa.gov/report.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Southeast Aroostook
